Sara shackleton enron north america corp. 1400 smith street, eb 3801a houston, texas 77002 713-853-5620 (phone) 713-646-3490 (fax) sara.shackleton@enron.com ----- forwarded by sara shackleton/hou/ect on 03/27/2001 10:27 am ----- sara shackleton 03/27/2001 09:05 am to: martin rosell/osl/ect cc: subject: re: commodity futures modernization act martin: how are things going? in response to your question, there is no internal memo but we do have copies of external lawfirm memoranda. Yes, ena has changed its isda schedule form to provide for the "eligible contract participant" rep and line of business. I'll verify with susan bailey as to whether these changes have been subnitted to ectric.
polished:
Dear Martin,

I am writing to follow up on my previous email regarding the updates to the Commodity Futures Modernization Act (CFMA) in the United States. As previously communicated, the relevant changes were sent to Mark Evans for distribution purposes.

I am Sara Shackleton, Enron North America Corporation, located at 1400 Smith Street, Suite 3801A, Houston, Texas 77002. You can reach me at 713-853-5620 (phone) or 713-646-3490 (fax), or via email at sara.shackleton@enron.com.

I have forwarded this email to you on March 27, 2001, at 10 27 a.m. My initial email was sent at 9 05 a.m. on the same day.

To address your inquiry, I would like to inform you that we do not have an internal memo regarding the CFMA. However, we do have access to external law firm memoranda that provide valuable insights. Enron North America has modified its ISDA schedule form to accommodate

original: Tdonoho (non-privileged).pst this has been a tough couple of weeks. I hope that these daily communications on new developments are helping you understand what's happening with our company. Here's a rundown of events from last week: we executed a commitment letter with jpmorgan and salomon smith barney that will provide us with additional secured credit lines worth $1 billion. Our northern natural gas company and transwestern pipeline company will support these assets. We now have received a total of $4 billion in credit lines, which we will use to pay off short-term commercial debt and maintain liquidity. Our board of directors elected a new member to the board - william powers, jr., the dean of the university of texas school of law in austin, texas.
polished: Here is a summary of recent events  We have had a challenging couple of weeks, but I am glad that these daily updates on company developments are helping you stay informed. We are pleased to announce that we have executed a commitment letter with JPMorgan and Salomon Smith Barney, securing an additional $1 billion in secured credit lines. This will enable us to pay off our short-term commercial debt and maintain our liquidity. We are proud to announce that we have received a total of $4 billion in credit lines, which will be used to support our Northern Natural Gas Company and Transwestern Pipeline Company, as well as our other assets. Our Board of Directors has elected a new member, William Powers, Jr., the Dean of the University of Texas School of Law in Austin, Texas, to join our team.

original: Skean.nsf i am attaching the ferc order and staff recommendations. The order provides for $69 million in "potential" refunds (either pay up or provide cost justification). Enron was not named as one of the 13 overcharging parties, but pge was ($3.18 million). It's not over yet, though. The order deals only with jan 01 and promises further orders regarding dec 00 and benchmark prices through april 01. The prices used to determine refunds were fairly high ($273/mwh based on gas prices, emissions costs and an assumed heat rate of over 16000). With respect to sales to california, we have concluded at least one short term sale and have talked with cal dept of water resources about longer term deals, but we were still struggling with credit issues, last i heard.
polished: I am attaching the final order and staff recommendations for the FERC order, which provides for $69 million in potential refunds (either pay up or provide cost justification). Enron was not named as one of the 13 overcharging parties, but PGE was $3.18 million. It is not over yet, though. The order deals only with January 1 and promises further orders regarding December 31 and benchmark prices through April 1. The prices used to determine refunds were fairly high ($273/mwh based on gas prices, emissions costs, and an assumed heat rate of over 16,000). With respect to sales to California, we have concluded at least one short-term sale and have talked with the California Department of Water Resources about longer-term deals, but we were still struggling with credit issues, as I was last informed.

Mike

original: It puts the ball in the net or it gets the hose again. Absolutely amazing, have nothing negative to say about this game as it's exceeded my expectations and will probably exeed yours too. Fluid movement, bug/crash free, lots of story/content to put you through, options for each and every day such as multiple practices, events (sponsorships) and even games. This review is purely based on playing mycareer, and so far it's 10/10. Facescan worked really well for me (used it two times, first one made me have a downsyndrome forehead though..). Keep in mind, using the mynba2k17 app will allow for you to facescan for free and allow you to earn daily vc. #sellout
polished: The game is exceptional, exceeding my expectations and I'm confident it will surpass yours too. The game's fluid movement and lack of bugs/crashes make it an absolute delight to play. The sheer amount of content, including daily practices, events, and games, ensures that there's always something new to look forward to. As someone who's played through my career, I can confidently say that this game is a 10/10 experience. The Facescan feature worked well for me, allowing me to scan for free and earn daily VCs. Note that using the My NBA 2K17 app will grant you the ability to Facescan for free and earn daily VCs. Overall, I highly recommend this game, and I'm confident you'll find it to be an excellent addition to your gaming library.

original: Magic fans beware... Wizards is afraid to make a decent digital game. At its core magic the gathering is a social game. A game to enjoy with your friends (or frenemies) laughing, talking smack, and dropping game winning bombs. Wizards of the coast seems to have forgotten this. If you choose to play with friends you cant earn gold, and gold is important. Gold is so important that they have implemented a daily cap, understandable considering gold unlocks everything in game. But get ready for a long and boring 1v1 grind against the computer or random oponents, whom you can't even speak to. If you choose to play for free, it will take you roughly 4 hours a day for upwards of a month, by yourself, to unlock the cards.
polished: Warning to all magic enthusiasts  The Wizards' latest digital game is a social phenomenon that has lost its magical core. This game is designed to be enjoyed with friends, whether they be friends or frenemies, as you engage in hilarious banter, share laughs, and drop game-winning bombs. It seems that the Wizards on the coast have forgotten this crucial aspect. If you opt to play with friends, you can earn gold, and gold is crucial. Gold is so vital that it has been implemented with a daily cap, considering gold unlocks everything in the game. However, be prepared for a long and tedious 1v1 grind against the computer or random opponents, whom you cannot even communicate with. If you choose to play for free, it will take you roughly four hours a day for upwards of a month, solo, to unlock the cards.

original: Being the 3rd installment in the trilogy i'll get the bad stuff out of the way first. I quite hate pre-quals as it's technically going backwards in a story and not forwards (this is an issue for every pre-qual). Granted it offers more storywise. The combat feels sloppy and doesn't feel as sharp as arkham city managed to make it. As of writing this recommendation (26/10/2013) there is a game breaking bug that stops a side mission from ever being completed (main story not effected). Some gadgets are put at a rediculous hotkey that makes your hand have to travel the whole keyboard to get to it. It might sound like nothing, but while in combat it could potentially break your combo.
polished: The third installment in the trilogy, I will address the negative aspects first. I strongly dislike pre-qualifications, as it is a step backward in storytelling, rather than forward progress. Although it does provide more story depth, the combat mechanics feel sloppy and lack the finesse of Arkham City's combat, which was a major aspect of its success. As of the time of writing this review (October 26, 2013), a game-breaking bug exists that prevents a side mission from being completed (the main story remains unaffected). Furthermore, some gadgets are inconveniently located at a ridiculous hotkey, requiring an arduous journey across the keyboard to access them. Although this may seem trivial, it could potentially disrupt the flow of combat and even break a combo in the heat of the moment.

original: They basically fixed shadow warrior (2013) i.e. The bossfights are awesome, weapons feel very nice (maybe not as good as d44m's ones, but still solid), enemies aren't too spongy (if you're not too much of a retard with handling elemental and upgrade stuff). The upgrade system is really balanced and once you get around it, it's not too tedious. The elemental stuff and limited ammo softly forces you to use different weapons. Lots of cool unique (being the important word here while comparing sw2 to ♥♥♥♥♥♥ borderlands' formula of 'rng' weapons) weapons that stay viable through most of the game. The music is great, especially the main theme and of course stan bush's stuff.
polished: The 2013 installment of the Shadow Warrior series, Shadow Warrior 2, boasts a plethora of impressive boss battles, with weapons that are both visually appealing and functional. While they may not quite measure up to the standards set by the highly-regarded Dark Souls series, they are still a solid offering. The enemy AI is well-balanced, and once you become accustomed to the upgrade system, it becomes relatively unobtrusive. The limited ammo and elemental abilities force you to diversify your weapon choices, which is a refreshing change from the often-repetitive gameplay found in other games of this genre. The unique and varied arsenal of weapons ensures that many remain viable throughout most of the game. The soundtrack is also noteworthy, with the main theme and additional tracks by Stan Bush being particular highlights.

original: So many things was made wrong. I even dont know how to start this review. This all is refered to mycareer. My player is an outside scorer, pg, 1.71m, has maxed stats and got already all necessary perks. Ok, and now tell me, why the shooting skill depends to a person's hight? why a person who has 1.74m can not became so good in shooting as a person with 1.71m? i'm 1.87m in rl, made my first player with this hight and noticed then i can not reach a higher skill than 89. Why? thats a pure discrimination! and why the game does not tell me that before i create a char and not even then when i reach the skill limit after weeks of playing?!?
polished: I'm struggling to begin this review, as it pertains to my career. My player is an outside scorer, with a 1.71m height, boasting maxed stats and all necessary perks. I'm 1.87m in real life, and I created my first player with this height. Notably, I've found that I cannot reach a higher skill level than 89. This raises the question  why does the shooting skill depend on a person's height? Why can a person with 1.74m not become as skilled in shooting as someone with 1.71m? It seems like a clear case of discrimination. Furthermore, the game does not provide any warning or notification before creating a character, and even after reaching the skill limit after weeks of playing, I'm left wondering why this is the case.

original: I think this assassin's creed nailed the mechanics down on all fronts (ship battles, sailing, hunting (fish), parkour, etc). I felt much more attached to this character as well. The story starts out extremely rough but does get much much better as you play (i think this is with every ac game personally). Edward was quite the interesting character and so was all the side characters. I felt like all the collectables actually meant something in this ac game that i never got from any of the previous ones and maybe its because i felt like they had a bigger purpose in the game. They def were not required but they were fun to get and you got rewarded in a very balanced way.
polished: I was thoroughly impressed with the Assassin's Creed series, which excelled in its execution on multiple fronts, including ship battles, sailing, hunting, and parkour, among others. As I delved deeper into the story, I found myself becoming increasingly attached to the protagonist, whose character development was well-crafted. The narrative begins with a rocky start, but it gradually improves as the game progresses, much like every action-adventure game I've played. Edward, as a character, was particularly intriguing, and so were the supporting characters. I felt that each collectible item had a tangible purpose in the game, which is something I never experienced in previous games. Perhaps this is because I sensed that they played a more significant role in the story, even if they weren't essential to the main plot. They were enjoyable to collect and were rewarded in a well-balanced manner.

original: While i personally cannot recommend this game, it wasn't absolutely terrible. The gunplay is alright, so long as you have the money to purchase gun parts, which would be my main complaint with this game: it's pay-to-win. If i could get past that, the game would be enjoyable, as the hardsuit is fun to use and hrv is an excellent idea. I'd take this game over any call of duty title any day, but its pay-to-win microtransanction format is off-putting for me. If you are alright with this model, then by all means, have fun. But if you're like me and dislike pay-to-win games, just let this one slide; it's not our cup of tea.
polished: While I cannot wholeheartedly endorse this game, it was not entirely unremarkable. The gunplay was satisfactory, as long as you can afford to purchase gun parts, which was my primary gripe with this game  it's a pay-to-win model. If I could overlook that, the game would be enjoyable, as the hardsuit was fun to use and the hrv concept was an excellent idea. I would choose this game over any Call of Duty title, but its pay-to-win microtransaction format was off-putting for me. If you're comfortable with this model, then by all means, have fun. However, if you're like me and dislike pay-to-win games, I would advise against it; it's not my cup of tea.

original: While not perfect, this game has been greatly enjoyable. The save system and possibility of sudden death leads to some frustration. I'm on my first playthrough and i lost my main character around hour 10 of 20ish. Would have really liked a save to reload at that point. I've since picked up a 3rd party mod/save tool to avoid catastrophic failures. Plus the aiming reticule is on the small side and zoom is underpowered. With all that said, its been a blast. I'm not normally a zombie fan, but the combination of strategy, missions, first person shooter/beat em up is great. I've been playing it as often as i can get away... Just one more mission, just one more supply run - or i'm running away and want to get safe before shutting the game down.
polished: While I've experienced some minor frustrations, I've thoroughly enjoyed this game. The save system, unfortunately, is imperfect, as the risk of sudden death can be disheartening. On my first playthrough, I suffered a setback when my main character perished around the 10-hour mark, which is roughly 10% through the game. I've since acquired a third-party mod with a save feature to prevent such catastrophic failures from occurring. Additionally, the aiming reticle is slightly undersized, and the zoom functionality could be more robust. Notwithstanding these minor drawbacks, I've found the game to be an absolute blast. As someone who doesn't typically enjoy zombie-themed games, I've been pleasantly surprised by the engaging combination of strategic gameplay, mission objectives, and first-person shooter/beat-em-up mechanics. I've found myself playing it as frequently as possible, often finding myself thinking, 'Just one more mission, just one more supply run - or I'll be running away and want to get to a safe location before shutting the game down.'

original: An absolute great stragtegy game! having played every single other wargame (european escalation, and alb), i have to say this one fits well. The number of units are great. Not sure exactly how many units there are, but there's a crap ton!!! graphics are just beautiful, sounds are great, and the gameplay overall is epic. The ingame chat box at the main menu is very entertaining as well, no i am not kidding. However, if anyone thinking this game is 'easy', or if you are new to the strategy genre, it could take you quite some time to get it nailed down. Do not get upset, you will lose a lot of units. Just make sure you plan ahead, always have anti-air, and anti-tank.
polished: This game is an absolute masterpiece of strategy! Having played every other war game (European Escalation and Albion), I must say that this one stands out. The sheer number of units is impressive. While I'm not entirely sure how many units there are, it's safe to say there are a substantial amount. The graphics are stunning, the sound design is excellent, and the overall gameplay is nothing short of epic. The in-game chat box at the main menu is also an added bonus, and I'm not being facetious when I say it's quite entertaining. However, if you're new to the strategy genre or underestimate the complexity of this game, it may take some time to get accustomed to it. Don't be discouraged if you lose units – it's all part of the learning process. Just make sure to plan ahead, always maintain a strong defense, and adapt to the situation at hand.

original: I was negatively biased towards this game before i played it. Wasn't even sure about buying. I dunno, the whole portal gun and portals thing seemed weird to me even though i like science fiction. Boy was i wrong. The jokes and voice acting in this game is phenomenal. Just amazing. It's not cheesy (ok it's sometimes cheesy). And different story characters have all their own sense of humour. Those different characters do really have different personalities. And the level design; it's just rad. Btw i never played the first portal game. One of these days, i'm planning to if i can spare the time. I would never have played it if i hadn't played the sequel.
polished: I was initially skeptical about this game before I played it, unsure if I wanted to purchase it. The concept of portal guns and portals seemed unusual to me, even though I appreciate science fiction. I was pleasantly surprised, as I discovered that the humor and voice acting in this game are truly phenomenal. The story's not cheesy (although it can be cheesy at times). The distinct personalities of the various characters are well-developed and relatable, with each one having their own unique sense of humor. The level design is also impressive, with a unique blend of complexity and accessibility. I must admit that I never played the first Portal game, but after experiencing the sequel, I'm considering taking the time to play it. In fact, I wouldn't have played it if I hadn't enjoyed the first game so much.

polished:
Here is a polished version of the original text:

"Allow me to commence my assessment of this game by highlighting its notable strengths and weaknesses. On the positive side, the game boasts an impressive array of well-developed characters, a captivating storyline, and an abundance of engaging content. Additionally, the customization options are extensive, allowing players to create characters that reflect their personal preferences, including the ability to choose from both male and female protagonists. Furthermore, the game's romantic relationships are a significant aspect, permitting players to form meaningful connections with their companions, including the possibility of romantic interests. On the flip side, the game's graphics may not be its strongest aspect, although this is a minor criticism. Notwithstanding these minor drawbacks, I must confess that I thoroughly enjoyed this game. In fact, it is arguably one of the most exceptional role-playing games I have had the pleasure of playing, and I would highly recommend it to fellow RPG enthusiasts. If you

original: Yes, this is a nostalgia trip for thirty-somethings who remember (at least in the uk) watching the ever-irritating timmy mallet just for the five minute transformers cartoon. The voice actors for optimus, megatron, bumblebee, and many others are back, and instantly recognisable. The distinctive cartoon transformation sound is there. Graphically, the cell-shaded presentation is perfect, and very, very generation one. But aside from that, it's actually a very fun game. The combat mechanics are extremely well done. Transforming mid-fight is often a necessity, and woven seamlessly into combos, making it quite unlike high moon's excellent war for/fall of cybertron games. Another distinction is the heavy focus on melee combat, but some enemies (e.g. Seekers) require a switch to a ranged blaster.
polished: Embark on a nostalgic journey with this retro-style Transformers game, reminiscent of the beloved 5-minute cartoon series that captivated the hearts of 30-somethings in the UK. The iconic voice actors behind Optimus, Megatron, Bumblebee, and other beloved characters return, instantly recognizable and nostalgic. The distinctive sound design, reminiscent of the classic cartoon, is a masterclass in evoking a bygone era. Visually, the cell-shaded graphics are a triumph, transporting players to a bygone generation. But beyond its aesthetic appeal, the game's combat mechanics are a true standout. The seamless integration of mid-fight transformations, woven into fluid combos, elevates the gameplay experience, setting it apart from other Transformers titles. Notably, the emphasis on melee combat is a refreshing change of pace, while certain enemies, such as the Seekers, require a strategic shift to ranged attacks, adding depth to the overall experience.

original: So i downloaded the game and played it for a little while, and it was nothing special. I spent more time trying to log in though than actually playing the game. There is a bug where it says that there was an update to the terms of service or whatever and whenever you clicked 'accept' it would just pop up again. You have to restart the client for it to work. Now that isn't that bad but why do i need to link my steam and gface accounts? they say it is for dlc but why is that even necessary? it is also not reversable so now i know that a company i don't care about has access to my steam information. Now the game itself is so so. It is easily recognisable as a cod clone, except somehow they made the gunplay worse... How is that even possible?
polished: I recently downloaded and played the game for a short while, only to find it lacked any remarkable features. The login process was more tedious than the actual gameplay. I encountered a peculiar issue where the game prompted me to accept an update to the terms of service, only to have it repeatedly appear upon clicking 'accept'. The only solution was to restart the client, which was not a major inconvenience. I was perplexed by the requirement to link my Steam and Gface accounts, as I was told it was necessary for downloadable content. However, it's concerning that this information is not reversible, allowing an unknown company to access my Steam data. Moreover, the game itself was underwhelming, with gameplay that was easily recognizable as a clone of a popular title, except for the poor gunplay, which was somehow made worse. It's difficult to comprehend how such a fundamental aspect of the game could be compromised.

original: 4k+ at 60fps (gtx 970), dual audio options and includes neptune gear. What's not to love? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nygsb617tmo excellent port and a great entry point if new to the series. Just keep in mind there is lots of (skip-able) talking. As usual would suggest using a gamepad but personally i had no problems with a keymouse/mouse setup, both completely rebindable. Price is about right and wouldn't have been unhappy about a purchase. More then half the dlc is included free, which is still plenty to play with. Recommended game to all jrpg/anime/visualnovel fans, provided you don't mind long breaks between the action. Cheers. No commentary playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=plslfvijaupszez9af395mvnk63xnhsj1_
polished: Experience the thrill of 4K resolution at 60 frames per second, courtesy of the GTX 970 graphics card, and indulge in dual audio options that cater to your unique preferences. The inclusion of Neptune Gear adds an extra layer of excitement to this exceptional port. As a newcomer to the series, this game serves as an excellent entry point, offering a rich narrative and engaging gameplay. While there is some exposition that can be skipped, the game's pacing is well-balanced, and the rebindable controls for keyboard and mouse ensure a seamless gaming experience. The price is reasonable, and the inclusion of over half the DLC at no additional cost provides ample content to keep you entertained. I highly recommend this game to fans of JRPGs, anime, and visual novels, provided you're willing to tolerate occasional breaks in the action. For those seeking a commentary-free experience, I've curated a playlist available here  https //www.youtube.com/playlist?list=plslfvijaupszez9af395mvnk63xnhsj1. Cheers!

original: I experienced no performance problems even at release, and after all these patches it plays really well. Imo, this is a really great and fun game in truth, although the format may be somewhat annoying (where the free-roam city area repopulates with new enemies every time you progress the story). I particularly enjoyed the 'dual play' segments (where you can play batman + 1 more), and the ability to use the controller for most segments of the game but the mouse and keyboard for the tank combat segments was greatly appreciated. Driving your batmobile around the free-roam city, including when chasing the apc commanders, is actually quite enjoyable once you figure out how to use the breaks to skid around corners (and when you master that, driving around the city is really quite enjoyable!)
polished: I'm thrilled to report that I experienced no performance issues, even at the initial release, and after the numerous patches, the game plays remarkably well. In my opinion, this game is an absolute delight, offering an incredibly engaging and enjoyable experience. Although, I do acknowledge that the format may be somewhat unconventional (specifically, the free-roam city area repopulates with new enemies every time you progress through the story), I found the 'dual play' segments, where I could play Batman alongside another player, to be a particularly standout feature. The ability to utilize the controller for most segments of the game, while using the mouse and keyboard for the tank combat segments, was a greatly appreciated touch. Moreover, driving the Batmobile around the free-roam city, including when chasing after the ApC commanders, is an exhilarating experience that becomes increasingly enjoyable once you master the art of using the brakes to skid around corners, and when you've mastered that, navigating the city becomes an absolute blast.

original: Damn fine aaa fps shooter - that's the bottom line. It's looks, sounds and plays great - great fps mechanics, nice story, cool characters, flawless voice acting, and a badass soundtrack. Not for the faint hearted though - some of those cutscenes were pretty darn cruel and vivid. But when a game overall is so great, it's easier to spot the flaws, and here they are as i saw 'em: - no sli support - wtf? i had to put the game away until i upgraded my card, as it ran too poorly on my old dual gpu gtx 590. Make sure you have a fairly decent single gpu card. - stupidly small obstacles are often unclimbable.
polished: The bottom line is that 'Damn fine AAA FPS shooter' is a game that excels in its mechanics, storytelling, characters, voice acting, and soundtrack. While it may not be suitable for the faint of heart, its greatness is undeniable. However, upon closer inspection, some noticeable flaws become apparent. Specifically, the lack of support for multi-GPU configurations and the game's performance on older hardware can be frustrating. To fully appreciate this game, it is essential to have a decent single-GPU graphics card. Furthermore, the game's design sometimes features small, unclimbable obstacles that can be overwhelming. Despite these minor flaws, the overall experience is still well worth it for fans of the FPS genre.

original: English is not my native language. I am dutch. So please ignore any typing/grammatical mistakes in my review of this fantastic game. I will break down this review in a few categories: - graphics - controls - sound - gameplay - replayability - graphics: the game has been set in a comic-like style. The graphics are very slick: no unnecussery details. Nice colour-scemes. It totally works for this game. The graphics can be set on 'high' without stressing your system. I run this game on an i5 pentium processor, with nvidia geforce 710m card - 8gb memory and it runs like clockwork (windows 8.1). - controls: the game can be played with keyboard and mouse, but also with an x-box controller.
polished:
As a non-native English speaker, I'd like to provide an honest review of this exceptional game, despite any minor linguistic imperfections. I'll break down my assessment into four distinct categories  graphics, controls, sound, and replayability.

Graphics  The game's comic-like style is visually stunning, boasting sleek and detailed visuals with vibrant color schemes. The graphics can be set to 'high' without putting a strain on your system, even on mid-range hardware. I've played the game on an Intel i5 processor with an NVIDIA GeForce 710M graphics card, 8GB of RAM, and Windows 8.1, and it runs smoothly like clockwork.

Controls  The game can be played with a keyboard and mouse, but it's also compatible with an Xbox controller, offering a more immersive gaming experience.

original: You can see by the hours i put into this game that i enjoy it. This is everything i wished a search game from cod would be. But dont buy this game thinking its like cod, battlefield, or any other shooter game. Its a game in its own class and should be treated as such. Cant tell you how many times i hear new players ♥♥♥♥♥ and complain about getting killed really fast. Oh god forbid you get shot in the face and ♥♥♥♥ing die. It's not like that doents happen in real life or anything. Edit:ok so ive been playing this game for awhile now. Thrown all kinds of money at it. One of the best mp games around. A good thing to play when your your not feeling cs:go.
polished: This game has consumed a considerable amount of my time, and I can confidently say that I thoroughly enjoy it. I must admit, I have been eagerly awaiting a search game from Cod that would meet my expectations. However, I must caution you not to approach this game with the same expectations as you would with Call of Duty, Battlefield, or any other first-person shooter. This game is unique and deserves to be treated as such. I've had the pleasure of playing this game for an extended period, and I've invested a significant amount of money into it. In my opinion, it is one of the best multiplayer games available. It's an excellent choice for those who are looking for a change of pace from CS GO.

original: I'm 2 hours in and am dying from this game. So funny. Gameplay is also solid, art design is beautiful, music is surprisingly high quality and appropriate, the story/world has me interested, and the puzzles are fun. But the best thing about this game beyond all that is the comedy. If you've played any rpg since the dawn of video game rpgs you will laugh at the various jokes, parodies, and references; if you've never played an rpg before then you should still enjoy the game for its humor. If you played final fantasy 7 or x you absolutely need to play this game, without giving too much away... I had to actually stop playing after 2 hours to give my cheeks a break from laughing and smiling so much. What a delight so far.
polished: I've been playing for two hours, and I'm on the verge of dying from laughter. The gameplay is solid, the art design is breathtakingly beautiful, the music is surprisingly high-quality and perfectly fitting, the story/world has me thoroughly enthralled, and the puzzles are delightfully engaging. However, the most remarkable aspect of this game is its comedy. If you've played any role-playing game since the dawn of video game RPGs, you'll be in stitches at the numerous jokes, parodies, and references; if you're new to the world of RPGs, you'll still find the game's humor endearing. If you've played Final Fantasy 7 or X, you absolutely must play this game, without giving away too many spoilers... I had to pause my gameplay after two hours to give my cheeks a break from grinning from ear to ear due to excessive smiling. What a sheer delight it has been so far.

original: I'm really sorry, i try to be supportive of free-to-play games and indie developers, but i really didn't enjoy this game. The description sounded right up my alley, but the execution has done nothing for me. I love puzzle and exploration games, but i found this game to be completely unintuitive, and even after looking up how to progress i still just simply didn't find the gameplay itself fun. It also completely lacks a pause button, or if it does have one i never found it. Considering that a lot of sequences in the game are timed, this seems like a critical oversight. I also feel like this game is a lot more cut scene than it is game, and i end up just sitting around drumming my fingers a lot.
polished: I'm genuinely sorry, but I'm deeply disappointed that I couldn't find myself enjoying this game, despite my enthusiasm for free-to-play games and indie developers. The game's description initially resonated with me, but unfortunately, the execution fell short of my expectations. As a fan of puzzle and exploration games, I was excited to dive in, but unfortunately, I found the gameplay to be utterly unintuitive, and even after consulting online resources, I still struggled to find the experience enjoyable. The lack of a pause button is a glaring omission, particularly given that many sequences in the game are timed. This oversight seems inexcusable, especially considering the game's overall brevity. Moreover, I feel that the game is overly reliant on cutscenes, leaving me feeling like I'm simply twiddling my thumbs, waiting for something to happen.

original: This game.... Phew where to even start. It was absolutely beautiful, from story to graphics i was hooked. The story wasnt just some story but actually felt like i was that person, trying to figure out what came next in the story that my character was telling. Gameplay was great and i learned alot about myself through this game (mainly my fear of hights which i never had a problem with until the ice caverns). My gut churned the whole time, but i kept through for uncle fred! if you guys made a dlc or second game, i would be the first to buy it and recomend it to everyone i know. Thanks to everyone who was involved making this, you made a absolutely beautiful game.
polished: This game was an utterly captivating experience from start to finish. The story was beautifully crafted, and I was completely absorbed in it. The narrative was not just a story, but an immersive experience that made me feel like I was the protagonist, trying to unravel the mystery that my character was unfolding. The gameplay was engaging, and I learned a lot about myself through this game, particularly about my fear of heights, which I never had a problem with until the ice caverns. My stomach was churning the whole time, but I persevered for Uncle Fred! If you were to create a DLC or a sequel, I would be the first to buy it and wholeheartedly recommend it to everyone I know. A huge thank you to everyone involved in making this game, you created an absolutely breathtaking experience.

original: Sid meier's civilization beyond earth is a turn-based game in which you build your civilization to a certain goal or 'victory'. In previous games you were set on the earth's timeline going through periods like the stone age, medieval age, and the modern age; however, in this game you are set in the future on a mission to colonize a new planet. What i enjoy about this game is 2k took a new approach to the game and added some new mechanics such as the affinity system and orbital layer. What i didn't enjoy was that with these new mechanics the game could be overwhelming at times. What think could be improved on this game is that they could maybe incorperate some new artwork in the game such as the enviroment you experience when communicating with another leader.
polished: Sid Meier's Civilization  Beyond Earth is a turn-based game that challenges you to build your civilization to achieve a specific goal or 'victory' on a new planet. Unlike previous games in the Civilization series, this installment takes a bold approach by setting the game in the future, allowing players to colonize a new planet and navigate its unique challenges. One of the most innovative features of this game is the introduction of the affinity system and orbital layer, which adds a new layer of depth to the gameplay experience. However, some players may find the game overwhelming at times, particularly with the sheer amount of new mechanics introduced. To further enhance the game, it would be beneficial to incorporate more diverse and visually stunning artwork, such as the environment, to create a more immersive experience when interacting with other leaders. This could include the ability to explore and experience the environment in a more engaging and visually appealing way.

original: Great game ! tons of replayability and very fun zombie survival game ! def. In my top 5 zombie games ever played. Edit: after playing 60+ hours i can honestly say this is one of the better more ''realistic'' zombie games. It's very much designed like a survival horror as you must save up your ammo, heal your own wounds when you bleed out, take pills when youre infected, etc. Also, i find zombies to feel very natual to be well animated for a free to play game. P.s. : i would recomend getting 1 or 2 friends to play with, but the community is super friendly and you can usually make friends/talk with the people in the chat or over voice comms.
polished: The game is an exceptional experience, boasting an impressive level of replayability and immense fun in its zombie survival gameplay. In my top five zombie games I've ever played, this title stands out as one of the most realistic and immersive experiences. The game's design effectively captures the essence of a survival horror, where resource management is crucial to success. You must ration your ammo, heal your wounds when you're injured, and take medication when you're infected, all while fending off hordes of undead enemies. The zombies themselves are remarkably well-animated, making for a highly immersive experience. I would highly recommend playing with at least one or two friends, as the community is extremely friendly and welcoming, allowing for easy communication and potential friendships to form. Overall, this game is a must-play for any fan of the zombie genre, and I'm confident that you'll find it to be a truly unforgettable experience.

original: 02/07/2014 - it's a shame i can't thoroughly recommend/enjoy this game as from the short time i've played it,i know i'd be addicted if it didn't have the following 2 game breakers. . No aussie servers - one red bar puts you at a severe disadvantage,and creates unbearable lag. Mind you,i played through the offline training mode and it was stuttering/lagging as well (how does that even happen?). Couple that with the poor ping,and it just ruins the game. . Everything artifacts like crazy - the menu's,backgrounds,training and in-game. I've never had this happen before with this card and thought it might not like my oc. Set my gpu back to stock and sure enough,it didn't make a difference.
polished: It's a shame I can't thoroughly recommend or enjoy this game, as from the short time I've played it, I know I'd be addicted if it didn't have the following two game-breakers. Unfortunately, the game is marred by two major issues  the lack of Aussie servers and poor performance. The lack of servers is particularly egregious, as one red bar puts you at a severe disadvantage, causing unbearable lag. I've played through the offline training mode, and it was equally plagued by stuttering and lag (it's astonishing that this could happen). Combine this with the poor ping, and it utterly ruins the game. Furthermore, the game's artifacts, such as the menus, backgrounds, and in-game elements, are laughable. I've never experienced this level of poor performance with this graphics card and thought it might be an issue with my overclocked processor. However, I set my GPU back to stock settings, and, sure enough, it didn't make a difference.

original: Very late last night i finished this. The story is not very deep or interesting but what makes it stand out is the story-telling. The atmosphere is filled to the brim and the many collectibles do a great job at fleshing it out. I did learn a lot about the world of batman so it was a little disappointing that so few bosses were in the game. Oh well, there's enough future games to rectify that. The combat is the right amount of challenge but it's more on the easy side. Leveling up batman wasn't very satisfying. It's the gadgets you upgrade and acquire during the campaign which add for nice new gameplay mechanics. Getting access to previously unreachable places makes for a nice sense of progression.
polished: I recently completed the game last night, and while it may not be a deeply complex or captivating story, the storytelling is what truly elevates it. The atmosphere is richly detailed, and the numerous collectibles do an excellent job of fleshing it out. I gained a significant understanding of the Batman universe, which was a slight letdown, given the scarcity of boss battles. However, there is a bright future ahead, with upcoming games set to rectify this imbalance. The combat is well-balanced, with a suitable level of challenge, although it tilts slightly towards the easier side. Levelling up Batman wasn't particularly fulfilling, as it's the gadgets and upgrades you acquire during the campaign that add fresh gameplay mechanics. Unlocking previously inaccessible areas provides a sense of progression and accomplishment.

original: 'to the moon' is no mere game... Nay, it is a veritable experience, and it was one of the best of my life at that. Think telltale's the walking dead is sad? hohoho! well, it's no match for to the moon! never before have i been so depressed yet fulfilled over something purely fictional. This masterpiece represents the pinnacle of storytelling in my opinion, and the soundtrack is a gorgeously charming and perfect accompaniment. Yes, the controls are a bit finicky and the gameplay is not the strong point, but the story is so fantastic that i did not care one bit. Plus, the humor of the game is great as well and it definitely does not intrude upon the distinguished nature of the story... And the doctor who references are endless.
polished: To venture to the moon is no mere pastime... Nay, it is a profound and unforgettable experience, and it was one of the most remarkable moments of my life. I must confess, I was utterly enthralled by Telltale's The Walking Dead, and it's no exaggeration to say that it was a highlight of my gaming journey. The narrative is a masterclass in storytelling, with a soundtrack that is nothing short of enchanting and pitch-perfect. Yes, the controls may be a tad finicky, and the gameplay may not be the strongest aspect, but the story is so captivating that I didn't even notice. Moreover, the humor is expertly woven throughout, adding a delightful layer of depth to the narrative without ever intruding upon its distinguished tone... And the references to the world of medicine are nothing short of brilliant.

original: Bastion is a bloody brilliant game, with a really great storyline. Set after some calamity happened, you start to rebuild on the bastion. There's quite a lot of choice in the game, with the choice of what to build to give you an advantage, what weapons to use and what power ups to have on those weapons as well as what drinks to use to give you a bonus effect. The art style and music in the game is fantastic, everything looks so colourful at times, who says the apocolypse has to be dull. Best of all, the game has narration based on what you, the player do. So if you end up picking up a weapon then switch it for another in the armoury, the narration would say something of you taking along the new weapon.
polished: Bastion is an exceptionally brilliant game, boasting a captivating storyline. Following a catastrophic event, you embark on a journey to rebuild the bastion. The game offers an extensive array of choices, allowing you to construct structures that provide strategic advantages, select the weapons you'll wield, and acquire power-ups to enhance those weapons, as well as choose drinks that grant bonus effects. The game's art style and music are nothing short of phenomenal, with visuals that burst with vibrant colors, rendering even the apocalypse a visually stunning experience. Furthermore, the game's narrative is deeply personalized, as the story evolves based on your every action as the player. For instance, if you choose to switch to a new weapon from the armory, the narrative will reflect your decision, acknowledging the weapon you're now wielding.

original: I had originally bought this game in early development, when the only currency was spacebux, and there was no 'tech tree'. This was when the game was good. All of the guns at this point were equally overpowered, so there was no problems with imbalance; everyone could kill everyone at any time. Also, the game used to give you unlimited gun slots and five loadouts. You would think that for a game with 'bajillions of guns', they would at least give you more than 6 weapon slots and 3 loadouts before you have to pay to get more. At one point, i had about 3 pages worth of guns, and was planning on new ideas for more, because personally, that's where i found it fun.
polished: I had initially acquired this game during its early development, when the primary form of currency was spacebux, and there was no 'tech tree' in place. At that time, the game was still in its infancy, with all weapons being equally overpowered, which meant that there were no balance issues; any player could easily take down another at any given moment. Additionally, the game initially provided unlimited gun slots and five loadouts, which might have been a generous offering, considering the sheer scale of the game's 'bajillions of guns'. It was only later, when I had amassed a collection of around three pages' worth of weapons, that I began to feel the need for more variety, as I was eager to explore new ideas and strategies. This was because, personally, I found the sheer scope of the game's arsenal to be a major part of the fun.

original: This game was a surprising gem. One often sees rave reviews of certain products that are often misleading. In this case, the reviews reflect the fun of this neat little game. It is an odd mix between a classic 2d platformer and an moba, and does it with style. I found myself enjoying characters that i wouldn't enjoy in other moba games. I had expected this trait to continue, but decided to give a melee tank a go anyway. I was pleasantly surprised with the outcome and ended up trying out more as they were unlocked from playing games. The art style and interface is oddly charming. As such, i now use one of the characters as my avatar and a wallpaper from creating a card set for the game.
polished: This game was a delightful discovery. The reviews of certain products often feature glowing praise, but in this instance, the reviews accurately capture the enjoyable essence of this charming game. It's an intriguing blend of a classic 2D platformer and a MOBA, executed with panache. I found myself drawn to characters that I wouldn't typically appreciate in other MOBA games. Initially, I was skeptical about the potential for a melee tank, but I was pleasantly surprised by the outcome and ended up exploring more characters as they became available through continued gameplay. The art style and user interface are delightfully charming. As a result, I now use one of the characters as my avatar and a wallpaper from creating a card set for the game, showcasing my fondness for this delightful experience.

original: I just started playing, but i love this game. I put on my headphone and lose myself in the game for hours at a time. It's been awhile since a game has had that effect on me. The music sets the mood, the sound effects are right on, and the controls are perfect. I look forward to every combat, and they've optimized combat extremely well. I had my doubt about the navel combat system, but it is so much fun to lay waste to multiple fleets at a time! the only way to lose in this game is to fail to retreat. If the combat looks overwhelming just get outta there, regroup, and counter-assault. Thanks, devs, for an awesome experience!
polished: I've recently embarked on a new gaming adventure, and I must confess that I'm utterly enthralled by this game. Hours can easily slip away as I become completely immersed in the experience, a phenomenon that hasn't occurred with a game in a while. The immersive atmosphere is largely due to the masterful combination of the soundtrack, sound effects, and controls, which all work in harmony to transport me to a world of endless excitement. I eagerly anticipate each combat encounter, and the developers have skillfully optimized the combat mechanics to ensure an exhilarating experience. Initially, I harbored some reservations about the naval combat system, but it's surprisingly enjoyable to unleash havoc on multiple fleets simultaneously. The only way to succumb to defeat is to neglect the importance of strategic retreats and regrouping, and instead, I've found myself getting outflanked and defeated. Kudos to the developers for crafting an experience that has truly left an indelible mark on my gaming journey.

original: The reboot of the devil may cry franchise has brought about many changes for the series, particularly for series’ protagonist, dante. While fans of the original series may be upset at the change to their beloved character, it’s certainly for the better; and this new game by ninja theory proves it. Dmc serves as the perfect point for newcomers to jump into the series. It shows the origins of an arrogant, cynical dante, and it chronicles his journey from cynicism to selflessness. Throughout, the game weaves a clear, narrative arc for the new dante, making him a compelling character to watch.image the story follows dante as he’s introduced into the corrupt world he willfully chose to ignore.
polished: The reboot of the Devil May Cry franchise has brought about a seismic shift in the series, particularly for its protagonist, Dante. The change may be jarring for fans of the original series, who have grown attached to the character. However, this new game by Ninja Theory proves that the alteration is for the better; and DMC serves as the ideal entry point for newcomers to jump into the series. The game masterfully crafts a compelling narrative arc for the new Dante, transforming him from an arrogant, cynical individual to a selfless hero. The story follows Dante as he is inducted into the corrupt world he willfully chose to ignore, presenting a gripping tale of his transformation from cynicism to selflessness.

original: Where do i start on this absolutely beautiful game. It's story, is absolutely charming. It has so much detail put into it, and it is a bundle of happiness, bad puns, annoying dogs, secrets. It is serious when it needs to be, but isn't a stranger to funny moments. The character design is on point, with there being various characters with various personailities and secrets to them. It sticks out from other rpg's because you don't have to kill anyone, which is an unused concept in rpg's. With lots of inspiration from earthbound, one of the best rpg's i have seen, you can tell that it is going to be good. It easily has the best soundtrack i've heard in forever.
polished: This enchanting game is a masterpiece of storytelling, boasting an captivating narrative that effortlessly balances lighthearted humor with poignant seriousness. The game's attention to detail is remarkable, weaving together a tapestry of happiness, clever wordplay, and engaging characters with rich backstories and hidden secrets. The character designs are masterfully crafted, each with their own distinct personalities and motivations. One of the most refreshing aspects of this RPG is the innovative concept of not having to resort to violence, which sets it apart from other games in the genre. Drawing inspiration from the esteemed Earthbound, one of the most iconic RPGs of all time, it's clear that this game is destined for greatness. The soundtrack is a sonic masterpiece, boasting a score that is sure to leave a lasting impression.

original: I am recommending this solely because it's free, and might be a more 'enjoyable' experience for others. As for my experience, the 'game' did nothing for me. Half the story relies on shock factor. I was not shocked nor emotionally moved in any way by this. Maybe i'm desensitized, or maybe it was too simple to warrant a reaction out of me. As for the other half of the game, it tries to paint a picture (literally) of a person in mental decline. It deals with obsession, hallucination, depression and a few other things. In theory it is a cool idea. But the 'game' took me 10 minutes to complete, and that is with reading and taking in every little bit of information i could.
polished: I am recommending this solely because it's free, and it offers a potentially more enjoyable experience for others. As for my experience, the game failed to elicit a reaction from me. Half the story relies on shocking elements, but I wasn't shocked or emotionally moved in any way, which may be a result of desensitization or the simplicity of the narrative. The other half of the game attempts to paint a vivid picture of a person's mental decline, exploring themes such as obsession, hallucinations, depression, and other mental health struggles. In theory, the concept is intriguing, but the game took me 10 minutes to complete, which is a testament to the need for patience and attention to detail in order to fully absorb the information presented.

original: Do i even need to explain why portal is amazing? portal is a puzzle game, it gives you a concept then gets out. It is an amazing way to test your mind while still being fun. Although this game isn't as story heavy, it did give birth to one of the most good popular games of 2011. I still play this game and beat it when i am feeling bored and i love to come back and to see what gave birth to a legend and what is a legend. Gameplay: portal's gameplay is quite simple, to explain at least. You use portals to your advantage, along with buttons that activate a part of the puzzle. Two buttons are in the game, one that you press and one that you need a cube to put on.
polished: Does it even need to be said why Portal is an extraordinary achievement? Portal is a puzzle game that presents a concept, then promptly disappears, leaving you with an intellectual challenge that is both entertaining and mentally stimulating. Although this game may not be narrative-driven, it has given rise to one of the most beloved games of 2011, and I still find myself returning to it when I'm feeling under-stimulated, as I'm drawn to explore the origins of a phenomenon and the enduring legend surrounding it. Gameplay  Portal's gameplay is refreshingly straightforward, at its core. You utilize portals to your advantage, in combination with buttons that activate specific puzzle elements. There are two buttons in the game - one that you press, and one that requires a cube to be applied.

original: If you can overlook the bugs (which i personally only had two: one minor and the other quite annoying) edit: both bugs are resolved one fix increased my fps from 60-90 to 80-120 and are looking for a space exploration game, i can definitely recommend this. Since most of these reviews are about specs, i'll include mine: i5 6600k (~200€) radeon rx480 (~200€) z170 pro - gaming (~150€) 16gb ddr4 ram (~70€) ~650€ is definitely within the medium price range though, granted, this rig is quite new. Almost constant 60+ fps on high settings vsync enabled i genuinely can't believe 90% of the comments saying they're rocking an overkill setup and get 20fps.
polished: If I can overlook the minor bugs, which I personally experienced only two  one minor and the other quite frustrating, I can confidently recommend this game for space exploration enthusiasts. The recent edit has significantly improved my frame rate, increasing it from 60-90 to 80-120 frames per second. With its impressive specifications, including an i5-6600k processor, Radeon RX480 graphics card, 16GB DDR4 RAM, and a budget-friendly price tag of around 650€, this gaming rig is an excellent option for those seeking a high-performance gaming experience. Although some users may argue that this setup is overkill, I can attest that I've experienced a consistent 60+ frames per second on high settings with vsync enabled, which is significantly higher than the 20 frames per second reported by many users. Overall, I highly recommend this game for those seeking an immersive space exploration experience.

original: Remember age of mythology? yeah, it's been that long since there's been an rts game of such quality. Divinity: dragon commander reaches awfully close to these borders of my personal most favourite rts game. Combine this with a huge risk-like grand strategy mode and there, it hit the spot. I am not (read: try not to be) overly biased due to the fact that this game allows you to turn into a dragon, aiding your troops by supporting, attacking and even commanding unit production, direction and spawning at the very same time. Honestly, i do like the complicated rts games nowadays. Think of civ v and so on. However, such games attempt to cram complex mechanics, charts and resources all into one complicated game mode.
polished: Remember the age of mythology? Indeed, it has been a long time since there has been an RTS game of such exceptional quality. Divinity  Dragon Commander comes close to my personal favorite RTS game. Combine this with a grand strategy mode that carries a high level of risk, and it hits the mark. I am not (read  I will not be) biased in my assessment, as this game allows you to transform into a dragon, providing support to your troops by offering guidance, leading units in attack and production, and even commanding unit deployment and spawning simultaneously. Honestly, I genuinely appreciate the complex RTS games currently available. I think of games like Civilization V and others. However, these games attempt to pack complex mechanics, charts, and resources into a single, intricate game mode.

original: Undertale comes together to make something greater than the sum of its parts. The graphics are solid for a retro title and the music is nice, but paired together they make some truly beautiful and impacting moments. The script runs the gammut from comedic to dramatic to heartbreaking to hopeful, sometimes all at once, and does this while turning rpg tropes on their head. And all of this without touching on the world, characters, story, gameplay... I could write whole pages about it. But instead, i'll just say this: if you like rpgs, play this game. If you like video games, play this game. If you have seven free hours between now and your death, play this game.
polished: The artistry of Undertale comes together to create a masterpiece that transcends the sum of its individual components. The retro aesthetic of the graphics and the melodic quality of the music harmonize to create truly breathtaking and emotionally resonant moments. The script masterfully navigates a range of emotions, effortlessly transitioning from comedic to dramatic to heart-wrenching to hopeful, often seamlessly blending multiple emotions into a single, impactful experience. Without delving into the world, characters, story, or gameplay mechanics, I could write an exhaustive analysis of its intricacies. Instead, I'll simply say this  if you're a fan of role-playing games, do yourself a favor and play this game. If you're a gamer at heart, play this game. If you have seven free hours between now and your eventual demise, seize the opportunity to experience this remarkable adventure.

original: If you liked witcher 1 and 2, witcher 3 is must to get. I would give normally for this game 10/10 but unfortunatly after 1.03 this game turned into buggy ♥♥♥♥ + random crashes, so remember to save really often. When i played version 1.00 -> 1.03 my game never crashed, i didnt see any bugs. Also i have noticed that after 1.03 patch drawing distance sometimes is horrible, starting to draw objects when youre really close, sometimes even people. But if forgetting all these bugs, crashes and drawdistance 'bugs', this is really fantastic game, they made huge effort on quests, some of them really emotional and deep, lots of side quests, and the fact that your decision effects a lot in this game. I have played over 50 hours now and still going on.
polished: If you enjoyed the Witcher 1 and 2, Witcher 3 is an absolute must-have. I would normally give this game a perfect score of 10/10, but unfortunately, the 1.03 patch turned this game into a buggy mess, complete with random crashes. To avoid frustration, it's essential to save frequently. In my experience, the game was stable and bug-free up until version 1.00 to 1.03, and I didn't encounter any issues. However, after the 1.03 patch, I've noticed that the drawing distance has become inconsistent, causing objects to appear late or not at all when I'm close by. Additionally, I've experienced some minor issues with people drawing in close proximity. While these technical issues can be frustrating, they don't detract from the overall quality of the game. The developers have made a significant effort to craft engaging quests, some of which are emotionally resonant and deeply impactful. The sheer volume of side quests is impressive, and the game's dynamic world is heavily influenced by the player's choices. After over 50 hours

original: I have only had this game for a few months, but in just that short amount of time, two dlc's have come out, along with patches that have made an already great game into an excellent one. The devs are very active in the community, and it really shows in the various discussion forums and dev diaries. There is a fairly steep learning curve to the game's mechanics of which i am still trying to learn; however, this breadth of strategy allows you a myriad of ways to reach goals and take advantage of certain situations. The game, in my mind, is almost infinitely replayable. I find myself sucked into every session i play regardless of how the play-through is going.
polished: I've had the privilege of playing this game for only a few months, and in that relatively short period, two DLCs have already been released, accompanied by patches that have transformed an already impressive game into an outstanding one. The developers' commitment to the community is evident in the numerous discussion forums and developer diaries, where their dedication to the game's growth is palpable. While the game's mechanics may present a steep learning curve, the sheer breadth of strategic options available to me allows me to experiment with various approaches and capitalize on specific situations. In my opinion, the game is almost infinitely replayable, and I find myself becoming increasingly engrossed in each session, regardless of the play-through outcome.

original: Warframe is a fun game for the first few hours of play. After those few enjoyable hours you'll begin to see that the only thing left the game has to offer is repetition in it's combat, enemies and game play. The one major high point for the game is that the developers are working hard and do semi-frequent updates that generally include a lot of content from sweeping changes to some of the game's systems, new warframes and other tweaks/features. It's a good game to play casually. Though i doubt it will hold your attention beyond a few months unless you just really like grinding. The upside to all of this is that the game is free so i'd recommend trying it out. If you're looking for a quick fix, try it out.
polished: Warframe is an entertaining game for the initial hours of play. However, after those few enjoyable hours, you'll begin to realize that the game's content is largely repetitive, with limited variety in its combat, enemies, and gameplay. The one notable aspect is that the developers are actively working on updates, which typically include significant changes to the game's systems, new Warframes, and other features. While it's a great game for casual play, I'm skeptical it will maintain your interest beyond a few months unless you're deeply invested in grinding. Fortunately, the game's free nature makes it worth trying out. If you're seeking a quick distraction, give it a shot.

original: This game is so.. Very.. Boring. I bought this game because i believed it was a pc version of 'katamari damacy', a popular and nice ps 2 game. Sadly it's far from it. In this game you go about, absorbing ever bigger things to grow bigger and absorb bigger things. But the gameplay isn't as smooth as it could be, the levels not inventive and what is in it is a surreal horror show. I don't mean an entertaining horror show but, one that makes you rather depressed and rethink whether being alive is all it should be. Every 'living' creature in this game from small pets to human beings makes me wonder if the creators of this game had an interest in taxidermy.
polished: This game is a disappointing experience, to say the least. I was misled into thinking it was a PC version of 'Katamari Damacy', a game I had fond memories of playing on the PlayStation 2. Unfortunately, it's a far cry from the original. The gameplay is marred by clunky controls and unoriginal level design, which makes for a surreal and unsettling experience. It's not just the gameplay that's the problem, but the game's atmosphere and themes, which left me feeling uneasy and questioning the meaning of existence. Every living creature in this game, from small pets to human beings, seems to be a mere prop, leading me to wonder if the game's creators had a fascination with taxidermy.

original: Alright. Let me explain a few things, as a person very intrested in politics, i was very interested in this game when i first heard about it. I thought, 'oh wow! a simulator of the road to becoming president! that sounds fun!' well, it really wasn't. The game starts you off and says you need to pick a side: republican or democrat, there is no independent, or third party. A little dissapointed, but still optimistic, i carried on to see what i could do. I will give the game credit, the character customization, although limited, is pretty fun to mess around with. It's the only time its an option to wear your head or not in a campaign. Literally.
polished: Here's my review of the game  "I was initially intrigued when I first learned about this game, as someone who is deeply interested in politics. The concept of a simulator for the road to becoming president seemed fascinating. Unfortunately, my excitement was short-lived, as the game's initial presentation was quite underwhelming. The game starts by asking you to choose a side  Republican, Democrat, or third-party options are not available. Despite my initial disappointment, I decided to continue playing to see what I could accomplish. I do give the game credit for its character customization, which, although limited, is still enjoyable to play around with. The ability to wear a head or not in a campaign is a unique feature, to say the least.

original: Fallout 3 story was better. Settlements get in the way of the story to the point you'll hate baby sitting them instead of playing the story. Some keys are hard coded and cannot be rebound. Bugs galore. My pipboy disappeared permanently at one point and had to research console commands to get it back. You don't have to work for power armor it's basically given to you from the beginning of the game and power cores are everywhere in trader shops. Value of power armor diminished greatly from previous fallout games. Story is medicore, everything about this game is mediocre except it doesn't crash every 10 mins like fallout 3. Very stable compared to fallout 3. Is it better than fallout 3 no. Is it better than new vegas? no. This title was so overhyped for how bad it actually is.
polished: The Fallout 3 story is marred by the fact that settlements often obstruct the narrative, making it frustrating to play through them instead of immersing oneself in the story. Some keys are hard-coded and cannot be rebound, resulting in a plethora of bugs and glitches. I experienced a particularly egregious issue where my Pip-Boy disappeared permanently, requiring me to research console commands to recover it. Unlike previous Fallout games, the value of power armor is greatly diminished, and power cores are abundant in trader shops. The story is mediocre, with everything about this game being underwhelming, except for its stability, which is significantly improved compared to Fallout 3. However, it is not better than Fallout 3, and it is not better than Fallout  New Vegas. The title was grossly overhyped for its subpar quality, which is a letdown for fans of the series.

original: My stats (at the time of writing this review): - 8.6 hrs to get to the end - 10 collectibles found out of 25 - zero achievements out of 15 what i liked: - visuals up until the last level (ice caves) - story is not that great, but the ending (after the closing credits) kind of made me not regret so much spending my time playing this game what i disliked: - visuals in the last level are uninteresting - gameplay in the last level gets much harder making it become a frustrating experience of having to do a lot of things over and over again until you get it right - achievements are too hard. There are 13 (out of 15) that only less than 2,1% of players achieved!
polished: My gaming experience with this game was marked by a significant amount of time spent, with a total of 8.6 hours dedicated to reaching its conclusion. Throughout my journey, I discovered a total of 10 collectibles out of a possible 25, and unfortunately, I did not achieve any of the 15 available achievements. The aspects that I enjoyed the most were the visuals, which remained impressive until the very end, particularly the ice caves. While the story itself was not particularly remarkable, the ending, however, left a lasting impression, making the time I invested in playing this game feel worthwhile. On the other hand, the visuals in the final level were underwhelming, and the gameplay became increasingly frustrating as it became necessary to repeat the same tasks numerous times before achieving success. Moreover, the achievements were extremely challenging, with only 1.7% of players, including myself, managing to achieve more than 2 of the 15 available.

original: Pros: +graphic cons: -bugs(especially the environment, you may get stuck or your shots may hit a invisible wall despite having clear line of sight of the enemy) -game is handholding/ babysitting you -dumb ai -enemies always seem to know where you are when you are spotted -godlike accuracy by the enemy which is frustrating like the first ghost warrior. -terrible checkpoints and saves. -boring story that i couldn't care less about will not recommend it unless its 90% off even then i find playing this game to be an extremely boring chore, just playing for the sake of finishing it to move unto the next game in my library. Considering the time i wasted on the first ghost warrior (which was equally boring and i feel liberated when i finished it), i probably won't play it until the end.
polished:
Pros  +Graphics. Cons 

- The game is marred by numerous bugs, particularly in the environment, which can cause frustration and even lead to becoming stuck or having your shots hit an invisible wall, despite having a clear line of sight on the enemy.
- The game's hand-holding and babysitting approach can be overly reliant on the AI, making it feel more like a chore to play.
- Enemies seem to have a God-like accuracy, making it disconcerting when you're spotted, like the first Ghost Warrior.
- The game's checkpoints and saves are also subpar, adding to the overall frustration.
- The story is underwhelming and unengaging, making it difficult to care about it. Unless it's at a significant discount (90% off), I wouldn't recommend it. Even then, playing this game feels like an extremely tedious task, only done to check it off my library and move on to the next game. Considering the time I wasted on the first Ghost Warrior (which was equally underwhelming), I'm likely to put off playing this one until the very end.
